title: [BUG] mlflow.pyfunc does not support dict conda_env

labels.name: Acknowledged
labels.description: This issue has been read and acknowledged by the MLflow admins.

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)
for information on what types of issues we address. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

Please fill in this template and do not delete it unless you are sure your issue is outside its scope.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: Binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.5.0 and 1.7.0
- **Python version**: 3.6.10
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: N/A
- **Exact command to reproduce**: `python -c "import mlflow.pyfunc; mlflow.pyfunc.log_model('x', 'x', conda_env={})"`

### Describe the problem
[The documentation](https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.pyfunc.html#mlflow.pyfunc.log_model) describes `conda_env` of `mlflow.pyfunc.log_model()` as:
> Either a dictionary representation of a Conda environment or the path to a Conda environment yaml file.

But `mlflow.pyfunc.log_model()` denies `conda_env` as a `dict`.

### Code to reproduce issue
```python
>>> import mlflow.pyfunc
>>> mlflow.pyfunc.log_model('x', 'x', conda_env={})
Traceback (most recent call last):
  ...
TypeError: stat: path should be string, bytes, os.PathLike or integer, not dict
```

### Other info / logs
N/A
